item.title: Change default Keyboard Shortcut – MySQL WorkBench
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
Changing the data/main_menu.xml file to change the execute SQL shortcut doesn’t seem to work as suggested. I changed it from Modifier+Shift+Return to F5 and nothing happens, even after restarting the application. Any thoughts? <value type=”object” struct-name=”app.MenuItem” id=”com.mysql.wb.menu.query.exec” > <link type=”object”…

The post Change default Keyboard Shortcut – MySQL WorkBench appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Changing the data/main_menu.xml file to change the execute SQL shortcut doesn’t seem to work as suggested.

I changed it from Modifier+Shift+Return to F5 and nothing happens, even after restarting the application.

Any thoughts?

<value type=”object” struct-name=”app.MenuItem” id=”com.mysql.wb.menu.query.exec” >
<link type=”object” key=”owner” struct-name=”app.MenuItem”>com.mysql.wb.menu.query</link>
<value type=”string” key=”caption”>Execute (All or Selection)</value>
<value type=”string” key=”name”>query.execute</value>
<value type=”string” key=”command”>builtin:query.execute</value>
<value type=”string” key=”itemType”>action</value>
<value type=”string” key=”shortcut”>F5</value>
</value>

 

Reference Source : Mysql Workbench Forum

The post Change default Keyboard Shortcut – MySQL WorkBench appeared first on .

item.title: Microsoft Launch Visual Studio Live Share
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
Microsoft is slowly coming to open source era which was started early days back. First stroke of Microsoft was launching Visual Studio C++ with all extension which is required and love to have all developer nowadays. Next big things is…

The post Microsoft Launch Visual Studio Live Share appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Microsoft is slowly coming to open source era which was started early days back. First stroke of Microsoft was launching Visual Studio C++ with all extension which is required and love to have all developer nowadays. Next big things is coming as yesterday launch of live share functionality.

What is Live Share?
Live Share enables your team to quickly collaborate on the same codebase without the need to synchronize code or to configure the same development tools, settings, or environment.

Reference Source : Introducing Visual Studio Live Share

The post Microsoft Launch Visual Studio Live Share appeared first on .

item.title: Open source code tool for developer
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
Visual Studio – https://code.visualstudio.com/ Sublime text editor – https://www.sublimetext.com/   Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux. It comes with built-in support for JavaScript, TypeScript…

The post Open source code tool for developer appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
• Visual Studio – https://code.visualstudio.com/
  • Sublime text editor – https://www.sublimetext.com/

 

Visual Studio Code is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux. It comes with built-in support for JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js and has a rich ecosystem of extensions for other languages (such as C++, C#, Python, PHP, Go)

The post Open source code tool for developer appeared first on .

item.title: Install mcrypt for php on Mac OSX
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
mcrypt is a file encryption method using secure techniques to exchange data. It is required for some web apps for example , the shopping cart software or a php framework likeLaravel. This tutorial has been tested in OSX 10.10 Yosemite. This…

The post Install mcrypt for php on Mac OSX appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
mcrypt is a file encryption method using secure techniques to exchange data. It is required for some web apps for example , the shopping cart software or a php framework likeLaravel. This tutorial has been tested in OSX 10.10 Yosemite.

This guide is really for users with the version of PHP that shipped with OSX Yosemite which is version 5.5.14. Other downloadable AMP stacks already have mcrypt baked in.

ommand Line Tools

First up you will need the OSX 10.10 version of Command Line Tools which you can download via the Apple available updates in the App store.

Run in the Terminal

xcode-select --install

 

Getting it on in OS X Yosemite 10.10

This tutorial works mostly in the Terminal, launch it from /Applications/Utilities, change directory (cd) to the home account and make a directory that you will work in, call it mcrypt

cd ~ ; mkdir mcrypt ; cd mcrypt

Get libmcrypt 2.5.8 from Sourceforge,  this is direct download link.

Get the php code in a tar.gz or .bz2 format- (version 5.5.14 is the one that currently ships with OSX 10.10)

Move both of these files that you downloaded into your working directory – mcrypt in this instance, and go back to Terminal

cd ~/mcrypt

Expand both files via the command line or just double click them in the Finder:

tar -zxvf libmcrypt-2.5.8.tar.gz
tar -zxvf php-5.5.9.tar.gz

Remove the compressed archives

rm *.gz

Any errors on the command line including C++ and g++ mostly are due to the command line tools missing.

 

Configuring libmcrypt

Change directory into libmcrypt
cd libmcrypt-2.5.8
Libmcrypt needs to be configured, enter
./configure
make
sudo make install

With the libmcrypt configured and libraries now installed, time for to make the mcrypt extension.

 

Install Autoconf

Install autoconf – some more Terminal heavy lifting:

cd ~/mcrypt
curl -O http://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/autoconf/autoconf-latest.tar.gz
tar xvfz autoconf-latest.tar.gz
cd autoconf-2.69/
./configure
make
sudo make install

 

Compile mcrypt php Extension

cd ../php-5.5.9/ext/mcrypt/
/usr/bin/phpize

Output should be similar to:

Configuring for:
PHP Api Version: 20121113
Zend Module Api No: 20121212
Zend Extension Api No: 220121212

./configure
make
sudo make install

The result of this should be similar to:

Installing shared extensions:  /usr/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20121212/

 

Enabling mcrypt.so  php Extension

Open /etc/php.ini and add the line below at the end

extension=mcrypt.so

If there is no php.ini file,  then you need to make one from php.ini.default in the same location like so:

sudo cp /etc/php.ini.default /etc/php.ini

And allow write capability

sudo chmod u+w  /etc/php.ini

Then add the line as above in your favourite text editor:

sudo nano /etc/php.ini

or

sudo vi /etc/php.ini

and add in the line:

extension=mcrypt.so

Restart Apache

sudo apachectl restart

That’s it, create a php page with the function phpinfo();  to see if it loaded correctly.

 

If it didn’t load you may need to declare the extensions directory in /etc/php.ini

extension_dir = "/usr/lib/php/extensions/no-debug-non-zts-20100525/"

 

The post Install mcrypt for php on Mac OSX appeared first on .

item.title: Share PC internet connection over wifi in ubuntu
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
Trying to share PC internet connection using WiFi device or dongle in Ubuntu Os ? To get started, press Ctrl+Alt+T on keyboard to open the terminal. When it opens, run the commands below one by one to install ap-hotspot. Ap-hotspot…

The post Share PC internet connection over wifi in ubuntu appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Trying to share PC internet connection using WiFi device or dongle in Ubuntu Os ?

To get started, press Ctrl+Alt+T on keyboard to open the terminal. When it opens, run the commands below one by one to install ap-hotspot.

Ap-hotspot is an open-source project that automatically creates an infrastructure (Access Point mode) wireless hotspot in Ubuntu that should work with Android and Windows Phone devices

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:nilarimogard/webupd8
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install ap-hotspot
sudo ap-hotspot configure

sudo ap-hotspot start

Use this configuration in your android phone or laptop for connection

To stop the wireless hotspot, execute this command in Ubuntu terminal:

sudo ap-hotspot stop

The post Share PC internet connection over wifi in ubuntu appeared first on .

item.title: How to add virtual host in ubuntu
item.dc:creator: Arvind Kumar
item.description:
1) Edit the file /etc/hosts and add host in file 127.0.0.1 foo 2) Go to /etc/apache2/sites-available/ and create a file with name foo (file name should be hostname ) and content of file will be like ServerName foo DocumentRoot /var/www/foo/foo…

The post How to add virtual host in ubuntu appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
1) Edit the file /etc/hosts and add host in file
127.0.0.1 foo

2) Go to /etc/apache2/sites-available/ and create a file with name foo (file name should be hostname ) and content of file will be like


ServerName foo
DocumentRoot /var/www/foo/foo

# Other directives here

Options FollowSymLinks
AllowOverride None


Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews
AllowOverride None
Order allow,deny
allow from all

3) Run below commands to activate host

sudo a2ensite foo
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 reload

The post How to add virtual host in ubuntu appeared first on .

item.title: How to install VPN on ubuntu OS
item.dc:creator: Avinash Dalvi
item.description:
To install the latest Java JRE and Plugin on Linux:  Run the command “sudo apt-­get install ­y ia32­libs” to install 32­bit support.  Go to http://www.java.com/en/download and click on the “Free Java Download” button. Click the “Linux x64” option.  Move the…

The post How to install VPN on ubuntu OS appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
To install the latest Java JRE and Plugin on Linux:

  1.  Run the command “sudo apt-­get install ­y ia32­libs” to install 32­bit support.
  2.  Go to http://www.java.com/en/download and click on the “Free Java Download” button.
    Click the “Linux x64” option.
  3.  Move the downloaded file to “/usr/java” with the command “sudo mv filename.bin
    /usr/java” subsituting filename for the file that was downloaded.
  4.  If this folder doesn’t already exist, create it with the command “sudo mkdir /usr/java”.If
    the file isn’t already executable, run the command “sudo chmod +x filename.bin”
    substituting filename for the name of the downloaded file.
  5.  “cd /usr/java/” then run the command “sudo ./filename.bin” substituting filename for the
    name of the downloaded file to extract the Java files to the current directory.
    Press the space bar several times to scroll through the license agreement, then
    when asked if you agree to the license terms, type “yes” and press Enter.
    There should now be a folder in “/usr/java” with the name jre1.6.0_version
    where version is the Java version that was downloaded.
  6.  Run the command “sudo update-­alternatives — ­­install “/usr/bin/java” “java”
    “/usr/java/jre1.6.0_version/bin/java” 1″ substituting version for the Java version that was
    downloaded.
  7.  Run the command “sudo update­-alternatives ­­–set java
    /usr/java/jre1.6.0_version/bin/java” substituting version for the Java version that was
    downloaded.
  8.  Change directory to the Mozilla Firefox plugins directory.
  9.  On Ubuntu, this directory is located at “/usr/lib/mozilla/plugins”.
  10.  If the file “libnpjp2.so” already exists in this directory, remove it with the command “sudo
    rm libnpjp2.so”
  11.  Also, if the file “libjavaplugin.so” or “libjavaplugin_oji.so” exists, remove it as well. This is
    the old version of the Java Plugin.
  12. Run the command “sudo ln ­s /usr/java/jre1.6.0_version/lib/amd64/libnpjp2.so
    libnpjp2.so” substituting version for the Java version that was downloaded.
  13. To check if the Java Plugin is installed, type “about:plugins” into the Firefox address bar.
    The Java Plugin and version should be listed.
  14. Go back to http://www.java.com/en/download and click on the “Free Java Download”
    button.
  15. This time, click the “Linux (self­extracting file)” option to download the 32­bit version of
    Java
  16. Move the downloaded file to “/usr/java” with the command “sudo mv filename.bin
    /usr/java” subsituting filename for the file that was downloaded.
  17. If the file isn’t already executable, run the command “sudo chmod +x filename.bin”
    substituting filename for the name of the downloaded file.
  18. “cd /usr/java/” then run the command “sudo ./filename.bin” substituting filename for the
    name of the downloaded file to extract the Java files to the current directory.
  19. Press the space bar several times to scroll through the license agreement, then
    when asked if you agree to the license terms, type “yes” and press Enter.
  20. You will then be asked “replace jre1.6.0_20/bin/java? [y]es, [n]o, [A]ll, [N]one,
    [r]ename:”. Type “A” to overwrite all the 64­bit files with the 32­bit ones.
  21.  The file that you downloaded can now be deleted using the command “sudo rm
    filename.bin” substituting filename for the name of the downloaded file.

To install the Juniper VPN client:

  1. Make sure that you have a password set for the root user. If not, run the command “sudo
    passwd” to set one.
  2. If you are using Fedora, run the command “sudo yum install xterm” to install a necessary
    dependency. If you are using Ubuntu, this step is unnecessary.
  3. Open Firefox and type “vpn.siu.edu” in the address bar to go to the VPN Login page.
  4. A Security Warning box may pop up and ask if you want to run the application. Make sure
    the “Always trust content from this publisher.” is checked and then click on “Run”.
  5. A Setup Control Warning box may pop up and ask if you want to download, install, and
    execute software with the product name “Host Checker”. Click the “Always” button NOT
    the “Yes” button.
  6. You should now be at the VPN login screen. Login with your SIU username
    (siu85XXXXXXX) and password.
  7. Once the page loads, click “Start” by Network Connect.
  8. Since this is the first time Network Connect is running, it wil

 

The post How to install VPN on ubuntu OS appeared first on .

item.title: How to install MongoDB on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: Arvind Kumar
item.description:
Please follow the steps for installation. 1.Import the public key used by the package management system sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv 7F0CEB10 2.Create a list file for MongoDB. echo 'deb http://downloads-distro.mongodb.org/repo/ubuntu-upstart dist 10gen' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb.list 3.Reload local…

The post How to install MongoDB on Ubuntu appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Please follow the steps for installation.

1.Import the public key used by the package management system

sudo apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv 7F0CEB10

2.Create a list file for MongoDB.

echo 'deb http://downloads-distro.mongodb.org/repo/ubuntu-upstart dist 10gen' | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb.list

3.Reload local package database.

sudo apt-get update

4.Install the MongoDB packages.

sudo apt-get install -y mongodb-org

If all above command run successfully ManogoDB is installed successfully.

a) Start MongoDB

sudo service mongod start

b) Stop MongoDB

sudo service mongodb stop

c) Restart MongoDB

sudo service mongodb restart

d) To use mongodb run

mongo

The post How to install MongoDB on Ubuntu appeared first on .

item.title: How to install nodejs on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: Arvind Kumar
item.description:
Nodejs is a javascript framework which run on server side and help to develop web application quickly. Follow below command one by one for installation. 1. sudo apt-get update 2.sudo apt-get install nodejs You also need to install npm (Node package…

The post How to install nodejs on Ubuntu appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Nodejs is a javascript framework which run on server side and help to develop web application quickly. Follow below command one by one for installation.

1. sudo apt-get update

2.sudo apt-get install nodejs

You also need to install npm (Node package Manager) which allows to install modules and work them with nodejs.

3. sudo apt-get install npm

The post How to install nodejs on Ubuntu appeared first on .

item.title: The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server.
item.dc:creator: Suraj Koli
item.description:
Error: The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. after upgrading php. Just run the below command on your terminal, which create symbolic link to your phpmyadmin directory. sudo ln -s /usr/share/phpmyadmin /var/www done..

The post The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. appeared first on .
item.content:encoded:
Error:

The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. after upgrading php.

Just run the below command on your terminal, which create symbolic link to your phpmyadmin directory.

sudo ln -s /usr/share/phpmyadmin /var/www

done..

The post The requested URL /phpmyadmin/index.php was not found on this server. appeared first on .
